1121848688727527424.text:
Stateless clients for Eth1.x are looking better and better. Last update from @realLedgerwatch
showed within-block deduplication of proof data reduces block sizes by 3x (from 1mb to ~300kb). New update shows caching across 256 blocks reduces to ~50kb!https://twitter.com/realLedgerwatch/status/1121683089757917184?s=19 …

1122484169882386432.text: The second round of @AragonProject AGP voting concluded on Apr 27. 9 proposals were voted on, with a mean participation rate of 3.8% of circulating ANT tokens - slightly down from a mean of 4.5% participation in previous rounds. 6 proposals were accepted, 3 rejected. 1/10

1075166074042167296.text:
Are we close to 100%? A possibly useful thought experiment is to consider what it would like to be moving 10x faster on ETH 2.0. 

- Could @ConsenSys bring in more teams to work on it?
- Is it possible to prioritize dev on Serenity Phase 0 (PoS beacon chain) ahead of sharding?

1072593728253104128.text: Ethereum 3.0 is a set of ideas for beyond the foreseeable Ethereum 2.0 roadmap (phases 0, 1 and 2). I'd say it includes Casper CBC, super-quadratic sharding, data availability proofs, private leader election, STARKs (signature aggregation, witness compression, VDFs, state roots).

1070785586917711872.text:
We need more community feedback on interest/inflation in Ethereum 2.0.

Personal opinion: We should err on the side of caution with generous interest. Validator interest should be increased by 50%-100%. Inflation would remain below 1%.https://twitter.com/econoar/status/1070713152864583682 …
